byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Pere Bosch in Barcelona, Spain; James Montague in Utrecht, the Netherlands; Bill Pennington and Ken Belson in New York; and Raphael Minder in Madrid.

abstract: Terrorist attacks in Paris as well as bomb threat that led to cancellation of soccer game in Germany has prompted sports officials across globe to reassess security protocols for stadiums and arenas.
lead_paragraph: Officials face the challenge of trying to keep events safe, despite, at times, lacking information.

headline.main: Arena Security Reviewed After Paris Terror Attacks
headline.print_headline: Attacks Prompt a Review of Security at Stadiums

snippet: Officials face the challenge of trying to keep events safe, despite, at times, lacking information.
